html:
12.10.18  5:57 am   If you could go back in time, would you add a de-esser to the vocals of New Canaan ?

     i've never found a de-esser that works, but i might make the manual dips deeper if necessary

12.10.18  5:21 am   what do i do when i get older?

     think about what you did when you were younger

12.10.18  5:14 am   bill, i have a set amount of time and a set amount of subjects to study in that time. i am freaked out because of the deadline and instead of working i'm thinking about how i could fail this thing. you have a lot of experience with deadlines and doing a lot of work. sure i'm working on it, but i have to work way harder than this to achieve succes . i know why i have to work, but i'm not productive enough . i don't have schedule. it's all over the place.

     i have no idea how to get on a schedule. the only times it has happened to me, it happened like a lightning bolt. once you are on it, you can stay on it. when you're off it, it seems impossible to even find it. this is why it's so important to stay on once you are on, and the only way to get on is some kind of lightning bolt which i don't know exactly how to find. but it seems to find you at the moment when you are so desperate for it that you have literally exhausted all other options

12.10.18  3:22 am   12.9.18  2:23 am Are you of the belief that perfection cannot be achieved if it is not stopped being looked for?

     yes

      Or do you think one gets to a point where they will now be able to make things they consider perfect?

     according to my calculations, the only thing guaranteed to be absolutely perfect would be nothing/everything, or some kind of completely blank / empty thing. which might not necessarily be any good in most situations

      Is perfect static or dynamic?

     depends if you want to have any kind of good time

12.10.18  1:53 am   What is the best motivation to keep moving forward and not fall into self-paralyzing perfectionism?

     i guess wanting not to be paralyzed

     shapes, and patterns

12.10.18  1:16 am   Have you ever tried to strum a bass?

     no

      Do you think if I tuned a bass to GCEA I could play it like a ukulele?

     it would make a roaring sound probably, unless you go up very high

      Would that be sacreligious?

     it will make a roaring sound, regardless of how it's tuned or what chord you play, unless you play very high on the fretboard

     take some calm, thoughtful walks. write down your thoughts and feelings

     because i didn't have time to get it done and also get the song done by tuesday. unfortunately even after cancelling it i didn't have enough time to do the song for tuesday. this is what is known in the business as 'spectacular failure'

     you must convince the courts to let you out

     yes

12.9.18  5:06 pm   What do you think of Ariadne Grandes "Thank you, next" song? Everyone seems to hate it. But I rather like it

     i think it's easy to be jealous and mad at it, because it is tearing up the charts. but i got up the courage to listen to it and i found it to be unquestionably awesome, which is what i would have expected

     it's your choice

      how have you gotten the most out of your equipment?

     very gradually, one riddle at a time

you did the two week schedule and thought it was impossible but it worked so you added an everything video so you were putting a video out once a week and also started another large history type project on top of those two things?

12.9.18  9:49 am   is it unnatural to be in entirely enclosed spaces most of the time? or at least a little offputting?

     maybe

12.9.18  6:36 am   Bill, I wanted to talk to you about something. I think that throughout my career as a musician I have contracted a virus that I can only identify as "bridge section fanatic syndrome" or something. It happens even with the classics, to me. Name an artist, I will likely be a fan of their bridges or "c sections" alone, even with their most classic songs. It happens with music from all eras (although lately I'm finding a lack in true bridge sections as an entity, if you will, specially in hip hop and trap, even though I enjoy a lot of the music). Those sections are NOTHING without the context of the song but somehow I find myself listening to the entire thing just to get there and enjoy them, justified in my enjoyment for having given that section it's moment to shine (not isolated) but preferring it to the rest of the track nonetheless. It's really weird and it just hit me, thinking about it. I find myself writing songs and instrumentals as strong as I can with the purpose of having the thrill of creating a bridge that I love, just for that piece of music. Does anything like this happen to you?

     yes

      Thanks for reading this convoluted text, I'm in the middle of  a tornado of self discovery.

     do new projects
